title: (x) The Mighty Eigth Air Force Heritage Museum logo - Bodega Sans {Tiff}
content:
Last week I had a font to ID, and I'd swear I spotted something here about a place to submit a jpg and it could be ID'd by computer, but I can't find that link anymore, so here here goes...:-)  
I need the text int he circle ID'd, if anyone can help, that'd be just spiffy.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [M8AFHMLO.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070622044607/http:/typophile.com/files/M8AFHMLO.gif) | 12.09 KB |

 [‹ Tuscan-style ornate characters in monogram](http://web.archive.org/web/20070622044607/http:/typophile.com/node/33091 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Harvard Continuing Education brochure - FF Meta, FF Scala {Jan Erdmann} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070622044607/http:/typophile.com/node/33031 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Castleman

comments.content: You're probably thinking of [Identifont](http://web.archive.org/web/20070622044607/http:/www.identifont.com/) or [What the Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20070622044607/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/) or something like that. This site ID's fonts by means of human beings looking at them and just knowing what they are by intuition. ;-)
